result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel Thomas Hamra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

Defendant shall be employed full time. 
If not employed full time, defendant shall seek work at a rate of 3 job applications per week and document monthly with DOC.
In addition to working full time, defendant shall work an additional 10 hours a week either with the same employer or a with a different employer for a hourly wage.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel Thomas Hamra

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Samuel Thomas Hamra appeared by video.  Attorney Stephen Jay Eisenberg appeared by video for Samuel Thomas Hamra.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Per agreement, defendant will plead to charge. State will recommend 2 years probation, concurrent, with the following conditions: to pay court cost, provide a DNA sample, to work full time or to seek 3 applications a week and provide documentation to DOC on a monthly basis, and to work an additional 10 hours a week. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Court accept plea and finds defendant guilty. State heard. Attorney Eisenberg heard. Defendant heard. Court heard and orders 2 years probation, concurrent with current sentence, with the following conditions: to pay court costs, provide a DNA sample, to maintain full time employment, if not employed full time seek work at a rate of 3 applications a week and provide documentation to DOC on a monthly basis, and to work an additional 10 hours a week.

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

You may join this hearing by video using the following website: https://wicourts.zoom.us/j/600348151 (meeting ID: 600-348-151).  To appear by video, you will need a web camera and microphone.  If you are unable to join by internet using video, you may join the hearing by phone by calling 1-312-626-6799 (meeting ID: 600-348-151). If you wish to appear in person, please contact Judge VanDeHey's Judicial Assistant at (608) 723-7826.
